text: The Lowland East Cushitic languages are a branch of Cushitic languages spoken on the Horn of Africa. There are around 25 languages in the branch still spoken. The most spoken are the Oromo and Somali languages.Richard Hayward, "Afroasiatic", in Heine & Nurse, 2000, African Languages ==References== Category:Cushitic languages
title: Lowland East Cushitic languages
